quest.name: The Base Fundamentals
journal: Forgemaster H'naanza wants you to assist a novice armorer who is struggling with the basics of the craft.

Granae, a novice armorer, has fallen behind in her task of forging bronze plate. To supplement Granae's work, Forgemaster H'naanza has requested that you craft twelve sheets of bronze plate and deliver them directly to the novice, hoping that your good example might inspire her to display similar diligence.

You have delivered the bronze plate to Granae. Her head swimming with visions of the fantastic armor she would forge, it seems the novice deemed her more mundane─though equally important─tasks unworthy of her time and effort. The sight of your exacting work, however, has convinced her otherwise. After promising to improve on her fundamental techniques, Granae suggests that you seek out T'mokkri at the Drowning Wench and try your hand at a few tradecraft leves.

※The next armorer quest will be available from H'naanza upon reaching level 15.
objectives: Deliver sheets of bronze plate to Granae.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Just the lasslad I was hoping to see.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: I have a new initiate that has near exhausted my reserves of patience, and I think she would benefit from seeing the results of a peer's dedication and skill─specifically, yours.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Her name is Granae, and, Builder help me, she is the most distracted, fumble-fingered craftswoman ever to lift a hammer.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: If she could but learn to forge the simplest of items without constant supervision, I would consider it a rare victory.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: <sigh> It is unfortunate that Byregot did not see fit to invest all of my armorers with your innate talents...

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: But I suppose we must all start somewhere─and if I abandoned every initiate that was slow to grasp a technique, our guild would have a grand total of, what, nine members? Mayhap ten. I jest...but 'twould be few enough for our clients in the Maelstrom to have to share breastplates.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: So what say you, Forename? You need only craft a dozen sheets of bronze plate to supplement Granae's own.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: When they are ready, I want you to deliver them to the lass in person. Mayhap your example will inspire her to take more care with her work.

dialogue.name: GRANAE
dialogue.text: Oh, you must be Forename! The guildmaster told me you'd be─ Wait, where did I put my hammer? Ah, there it is! Sorry, what were you saying? Right, yes─I would be most grateful for the extra sheets of bronze plate.

dialogue.name: GRANAE
dialogue.text: Gods...did you craft these yourself? Why, they are absolutely─ Whoa! Nearly dropped them! No harm done, though!

dialogue.name: GRANAE
dialogue.text: As I was saying, I can certainly see why the forgemaster speaks so highly of your work.

dialogue.name: GRANAE
dialogue.text: The bronze is the perfect color and thickness, so I assume you carefully measured out the amounts of tin and copper...? I always add too much tin. Did you know metal can shatter?

dialogue.name: GRANAE
dialogue.text: Well, I didn't. Truth be told, I've tended to put all my effort into making the armor itself, rather than bothering with the base materials. I mean, compared to hammering out glorious winged helms or ornate greaves, measuring out metals just seemed so...trivial.

dialogue.name: GRANAE
dialogue.text: But looking at your work, I'm beginning to wonder... I never realized how beautiful a simple sheet of bronze could be...

dialogue.name: GRANAE
dialogue.text: With materials like this, just imagine the sturdy, shiny suits of armor one might create!

dialogue.name: GRANAE
dialogue.text: It seems I've been putting the cart before the chocobo. From this moment onwards, I swear to focus all my attention and care on the task at hand. Even if the task at hand is forging bronze ingots.

dialogue.name: GRANAE
dialogue.text: And what of you, Forename? Do you have any grand projects waiting for you on the anvil?

dialogue.name: GRANAE
dialogue.text: I overheard some of the senior armorers boasting about the coin they made through tradecraft leves. Might that be something you'd consider?

dialogue.name: GRANAE
dialogue.text: They say T'mokkri over at the Drowning Wench is the one to talk to. And that's where I'll be heading once I improve my technique! Now where did I put that hammer...?
